page.title: 05Public Transport Dalgety Bay
page.content: The need for an efficient and regular bus service can be seen by the fact that there are only a few local shops and this necessitates travel to Kirkcaldy, Dunfermline or Edinburgh for clothing, furniture, electrical goods and foodstuffs not available in Dalgety Bay. Transport is also required to take people to work outwith Dalgety Bay. Even though the majority of families own a car, wives and children still require transport to get them to work and to the High School. There is an hourly bus service between Dunfermline and Leven, and between Edinburgh and Leven. These two routes provide a half hourly service to Kirkcaldy. A local service from Dunfermline to Dalgety Bay runs hourly from Monday to Saturday.
